Events.RelatedDescription: Pushed to refs/heads/prefix-upload at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Closed issue "request for blocker stats" (#4542) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
A question i have been wanting answered for a while now is "how many developers run ad blockers or anti trackers".  I think the nuget gallery would be a really good site to get an approximation of that number. Specifically i am more interested in .net/Microsoft developers so nuget gallery makes even more sense.

Now i know this is outside the scope of what the nuget team is trying to achieve, so i am asking very much form a "as a favour" perspective. Although it might make an interesting blog post for http://blog.nuget.org/ 

And i know you are very busy with the new preview site and work related to net core/standard, so i understand if this does not get prioritised for a while. And i also completely understand if you close this as "not worth the effort".

If u do decide to do this, there are a variety of ways to achieve this. for example one of the results of googling "test if an ad blockers is being used" is http://www.detectadblock.com/

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Package statistics graph contains wrong values" (#4571) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Graph with package download counts ([like this](https://www.nuget.org/stats/packages/Newtonsoft.Json?groupby=Version)) is displaying wrong values.

Version with download count "3 649 326" shows bar with height of 3, with " 700 877" downloads - bar with height of 700.

It seems that graph parses values until first space.

Here is screenshot:
![statistics-bug](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3540597/29405767-92deccb8-8347-11e7-825b-3a45bb37d2c6.png)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Upload Page points to http://www.nuget.org instead of https://..." (#4573) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
I noticed a small "bug". On the upload page you show the URL without https which might confuse people.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/756703/29433694-8e9f77a2-83a0-11e7-901e-8b40ca6cad64.png)

The part seems to be in your configuration:

https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/blob/e72e08ab541b0b47fafc7f6e1139644258b52004/src/NuGetGallery/Views/Packages/UploadPackage.cshtml#L14

I'm not sure if this is a typo in your configuration or if this is more like an internal URL. I could imagine that the SSL handling is managed by a proxy and behind that proxy you are using HTTP and thats why this internal config entry points to http://www.nuget.org

Events.RelatedDescription: Commented on issue "Very slow feed response times" (#4584) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Hi @OliverRC , can you provide additional information regarding your network and geo-location so we can investigate the network slowness?
You can find the instructions on how to capture an MTR log on our FAQ page: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/policies/nuget-faq under "Why can't I download packages from or upload packages to nuget.org?"
Please send the MTR log to support @ nuget.org

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Package upload fails without error." (#4592) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Customer reported issue: 

> Hello,
Whenever I try to upload an update (NabtoClientNative.4.1.4.nupkg), nothing happens after the progress bar reaches 100% - no text, no redirect, not anything. I can just try to upload again. The new update does not appear anywhere so it must have failed for some reason. I have tried in Chrome and Safari on a Mac and in Edge on Windows 10, exact same behavior. Any idea about what is going on?
Thanks!
Ulrik

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Deployment 2017-09-06" (#4591) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
# Deployment 2017-09-06 **Status**: Planned **Planned production date**: 09/06/2017 **Focus**: Gallery deployment **Services to Deploy**: - [ ] Gallery - [ ] Search.GenerateAuxiliaryData - [ ] Search Service Repo |Service | INT | PROD (primary) | PROD (secondary) --- | --- | --- | --- | --- NuGetGallery | V2 Gallery |
  • [x]
|
  • [x]
|
  • [x]
NuGet.Jobs | Search.GenerateAuxiliaryData |
  • [x]
|
  • [x]
| NuGet.Services.Metadata | Search Service |
  • [x]
|
  • [x]
|
  • [x]
NuGet.Services.Metadata | Catalog2Lucene | |
  • [x]
| **Related blog posts/docs**: - None **Deployed commit**: TBD # Deployment Process **NOTE: Order of the deployment is crucial here: the Gallery must be deployed first, GenerateAuxiliaryData second, and the Search Service last!** **NuGetGallery** - [x] Apply schema updates - [x] Run functional/end to end tests - [x] Deploy *Technical:* - DB schema changes and Reserved Namespace service changes - https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/pull/4590 - Reserved namespace visual indicator on profile/search/details pages - https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/pull/4601 - Related to #4601 fix for external search service - https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/pull/4606 **Search.GenerateAuxiliaryData** - [x] Ensure the schema updates have been applied to the Gallery's database - [x] Deploy - [x] Verify the `ng-search-data` blob container now contains the `verifiedPackages.json` auxiliary file - [x] Verify the contents of the `verifiedPackages.json` file is a well-formed JSON array of package IDs. *Technical* - Added job to generate verified auxiliary file - https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Jobs/pull/202 **Search Service** - [x] Verify **Search.GenerateAuxiliaryData** job has successfully been deployed (see above) - [x] Deploy **Catalog2Lucene** - [x] Update the Jobs.catalog2lucenev3reg2.Registration to wait for China registration cursor. *Technical* - Display Packages' Verified Status on Search Service - https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Services.Metadata/pull/226

Events.RelatedDescription: Commented on issue "Command line download URL for latest nuget.exe is still pointing to 4.1.0" (#4634) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody: By design. Please see the "updating process" that we use each time we release a new nuget.exe: https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/4851

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Command line download URL for latest nuget.exe is still pointing to 4.1.0" (#4634) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
In the downloads page, under the "Windows x86 Commandline" section, the latest link is still pointing to 4.1.0 instead of 4.3.0. Shouldn't it point to 4.3.0 by now?

I had issues restoring .netstandard 2.0 packages to a .csproj targeting 4.6.1, but forcing our scripts to use 4.3.0 fixes that.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Add AddPackageLicenseReport2 which supports a larger Value field" (#4633) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Progress on https://github.com/NuGet/Engineering/issues/743.

Our license report job is failing because the value generated here...
https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/blob/9eb4bc49f7f34339b0fc4a6183f9265509961cdd/src/NuGetGallery/Infrastructure/AddPackageLicenseReport.sql#L135
... is more than 128 characters.
https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/blob/9eb4bc49f7f34339b0fc4a6183f9265509961cdd/src/NuGetGallery/Infrastructure/AddPackageLicenseReport.sql#L55

The fix is to add a new stored procedure with a fix. I chose to use a new one so rollback of job or DB can be done freely and independently.

There will be another PR to update the UpdateLicenseReports job to use the new sproc.

Closed issue "TrustFailure (CertificateUnknown) Error" (#5864) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
After upgrading to Mono JIT compiler version 5.2.0.215, I can't restore packages because of certificate problem. Do you have a solution to trust the in-house certificates? it was working before upgrading Mono version.

## Details about Problem

NuGet product used (NuGet.exe | VS UI | Package Manager Console | dotnet.exe):

NuGet version (4.0.0.2283)

Mono JIT compiler version 5.2.0.215

OS version : OS X El Capitan 10.11.6

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem
1. After upgrading to Mono JIT compiler version 5.2.0.215

2. Behind a proxy, perform nuget restore command

==> 
Unable to find version 'X' of package 'Y'.
An error occurred while sending the request
  Error: TrustFailure (CertificateUnknown)
  CertificateUnknown

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Generate NuGet package on publish mode does not generate multiple target framework" (#5866) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
**VS version** = Microsoft Visual Studio Community 2017 Version 15.3.2
**OS** = Windows 10
**Project type** = .NET Standard 2.0

I have created a .NET Standard 2.0 project which target multiple .net frameworks like netstandard2.0, net461 & net47 and the package works fine in debug mode and I am able to see multiple target framework does generate on package explorer like below.  However, when I publish the package on release mode I see only .NET Standard 2.0.  Could you please tell me what I am missing?

**DEBUG** 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/554039/30236696-32d6a82e-94ed-11e7-9352-fee6d3c068d1.png)

**PUBLISH MODE**

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/554039/30236741-cbbedc54-94ee-11e7-86a7-9630162370c6.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/554039/30236843-b6037570-94f1-11e7-9f16-98eecfa72d89.png)

```xml
<Project Sdk="Microsoft.NET.Sdk">

  <PropertyGroup>
    <TargetFrameworks>netstandard2.0;net461;net47;</TargetFrameworks>
    <GeneratePackageOnBuild>true</GeneratePackageOnBuild>
    <!--<AutoGenerateBindingRedirects>true</AutoGenerateBindingRedirects>
    <GenerateBindingRedirectsOutputType>true</GenerateBindingRedirectsOutputType>-->
  </PropertyGroup>
</Project>
```
```csharp
  public class Hello
  {
        public Hello(string name) {}
       
        #if NET461

        public Hello() {}
        
        #endif
  }
 ```

Events.RelatedDescription: Commented on issue "Cannot disable Nuget warnings with dotnet 2.0 " (#5769) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
@xlegalles I agree. Ideally you should address and resolve the warnings. But sometimes it is not possible. Hence for restore you should be able to `NoWarn` them. If that is not working for you then let me know and I will work with you to understand/fix the problem there.

We do not have the support for `NoWarn` for the other commands yet. If you feel that is something you need then please let us know and we will discuss the feasibility for it.

Events.RelatedDescription: Commented on issue "Feature Request: NuGet.exe pack should drop resolved nuspec to support network share hosted Package Source" (#5850) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
"The request here is to do all of these actions at once to improve performance, correct?"
Yes, we have a large volumn of nuget packages and need pack command to do everything to prepare the files for the share feed.

Events.RelatedDescription: Commented on issue "Publish process for updating NuGet.exe" (#4851) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: @karann-msft - could you please work this into our doc plan?

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Use IPackageReferencesService to get package references from net core project system" (#5865) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Original issue was: test were not being discovered in Test window on solution load for net core projects. And that's because Test window team called into NuGet IVS api to retrieve package references for the project, even before project was nominated to NuGet so NuGet didn't had any information.

The current proposal from SDK team is to use `IPackageReferencesService` to get the list of package references for these projects without relying on nomination call.

Events.RelatedDescription: Commented on issue "`nuget push` sends empty package content in case of Basic Authentication used on server" (#5831) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: looks like a mono issue, @garuma Could you take a quick look?thx

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Update packages at solution updates/ installs for all the projects" (#5508) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
while updating packages at solution level, it checks for all the projects in solution irrespective of the fact that not all the updating packages are applicable for all the projects and construct installing/ uninstalling actions for all the projects. This is wrong, it should always check for the projects where list of updating packages applies.

This is a regression post 3.5.0 release for VS 2017.

More details from one of the customer repro: Customer was trying to update his own 15 packages from a local feed.

Current code with VS2017 - shows total 86 installs across 18 projects for different combination of 28 packages (even installing packages out of those 15)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18219758/27750622-70fcbbbc-5d8d-11e7-8e12-c1ed226b630d.png)

Where as it should have shown total 38 installs across 6 projects for different combination of 15 packages.

This particular scenario regressed update performance by ~10 mins (almost 100% regression from base time)

Events.RelatedDescription: Commented on issue "NuGet.exe list from local packages folder does not work with the AllVersion flag" (#4537) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: So at this point we are at (at least) _two years_ with this essential command line functionality being completely broken...

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "nuget restore fails when VS Test Agent is installed with a SxS SKU" (#5840) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

NuGet product used:
**nuget.exe**

NuGet version (x.x.x.xxx):
**4.3.0.4406**

dotnet.exe --version (if appropriate):
**2.0.0**

VS version (if appropriate):
**VS Test Agent 2017 15.3.3**
**VS Build Tools 2017 15.3.3**

OS version (i.e. win10 v1607 (14393.321)):
**Windows Server 2016 v1607 (14393.1593)**

Worked before? If so, with which NuGet version:
**4.3.0.4406**

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem
1. Obtain copy of latest nuget.exe
2. Install VS Build Tools 2017 15.3.3
3. Verify `nuget restore` works (uses MSBuild 15.3.x)
4. Install VS Test Agent 2017 15.3.3
5. Verify `nuget restore` fails
6. Uninstall VS Build Tools 2017
7. Verify `nuget restore` works (uses MSBuild 14.x)
8. Install VS Build Tools 2017 15.3.3
9. Verify `nuget restore` fails
10. Uninstall VS Test Agent 2017
11. Verify `nuget restore` works (uses MSBuild 15.3.x)

## Other suggested things
If you supply the MSBuildVersion flag: `nuget restore -MSBuildVersion 15.3` the restore works. But then the flag becomes required.

### Verbose Logs
```cmd
> nuget restore -verbosity detailed
NuGet Version: 4.3.0.4406
Restoring NuGet packages for solution C:\projects\MyExampleProject\MyExampleProject.sln.
Object reference not set to an instance of an object.
System.NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object.
   at NuGet.CommandLine.MsBuildUtility.<>c__DisplayClass22_0.<GetToolsetFromPath>b__0(MsBuildToolset t)
   at System.Linq.Enumerable.FirstOrDefault[TSource](IEnumerable`1 source, Func`2 predicate)
   at NuGet.CommandLine.MsBuildUtility.GetToolsetFromPath(String msBuildPath, IEnumerable`1 installedToolsets)
   at NuGet.CommandLine.MsBuildUtility.GetMsBuildDirectoryInternal(String userVersion, IConsole console, IEnumerable`1 installedToolsets, Func`1 getMsBuildPathInPathVar)
   at NuGet.CommandLine.MsBuildUtility.GetMsBuildDirectory(String userVersion, IConsole console)
   at System.Lazy`1.CreateValue()
   at System.Lazy`1.LazyInitValue()
   at NuGet.CommandLine.RestoreCommand.ProcessSolutionFile(String solutionFileFullPath, PackageRestoreInputs restoreInputs)
   at NuGet.CommandLine.RestoreCommand.<DetermineRestoreInputsAsync>d__42.MoveNext()
--- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---
   at System.Runtime.ExceptionServices.ExceptionDispatchInfo.Throw()
   at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task)
   at NuGet.CommandLine.RestoreCommand.<ExecuteCommandAsync>d__34.MoveNext()

>
```
### Sample Project
[Download the sample app](https://www.dropbox.com/s/161dposz9v4dm2v/WebApplication1.zip?dl=0) or just create a simple MVC Web Application in VS (or any project that happens to have a `*.sln` file. This might have something to do with it? I created a MVC app from scratch using Visual Studio on a different computer, copied it over to the server in question and attempted the nuget restore on it... it failed.

Simply, having both the VS Test Agent and the VS Build Tools installed on the same machine renders the `nuget restore` command faulty. Uninstall one or the other (preferably VS Test Agent) will allow the `nuget restore` command to run as expected. I do not have any full edition of VS installed (this is a BuildServer running TeamCity 10.x). 

It isn't favorable or entirely possible to inject the `-MSBuildVersion 15.3` value wherever I'm using `nuget restore`.

Events.RelatedDescription: Starred NuGet/Home

Events.RelatedDescription: Commented on issue "nuget restore fails when VS Test Agent is installed with a SxS SKU" (#5840) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: @nkolev92 Awesome! At your leisure, I would like to get that build you spoke of and test it out.

Events.RelatedDescription: Commented on issue "nuget restore fails when VS Test Agent is installed with a SxS SKU" (#5840) at NuGet/Home
Closed issue "Cannot disable Nuget warnings with dotnet 2.0 " (#5769) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem
```
dotnet --info
.NET Command Line Tools (2.0.0)

Product Information:
 Version:            2.0.0
 Commit SHA-1 hash:  cdcd1928c9

Runtime Environment:
 OS Name:     Windows
 OS Version:  10.0.15063
 OS Platform: Windows
 RID:         win10-x64
 Base Path:   C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk\2.0.0\

Microsoft .NET Core Shared Framework Host

  Version  : 2.0.0
  Build    : e8b8861ac7faf042c87a5c2f9f2d04c98b69f28d
```

## Description
This is linked to what I have commented in #5764: we have hundreds of NU1603 warnings and we want to disable them in Release in order to clean-up the build server logs. But it does not work: all `dotnet` commands (e.g. `restore` or `build`) ignore our settings and warnings are still displayed. We also have the same behavior in VS 2017 15.3.0

Here is a sample projet setting:
```
<PropertyGroup Condition=" '$(Configuration)|$(Platform)' == 'Release|AnyCPU' ">
    <OutputPath>bin\Release\</OutputPath>
    <NoWarn>NU1701;NU1702;NU1705;NU1603;CS0162</NoWarn>
</PropertyGroup>

```

Note that if I add/remove the CS0162 warning, it is correctly ignored/displayed.

Events.RelatedDescription: Commented on issue "Cannot disable Nuget warnings with dotnet 2.0 " (#5769) at NuGet/Home
Commented on issue "nuget restore fails while VS BuildTools and VS Test Agent are installed together" (#5840) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
The root cause of the issue is that we don't deal well with SKUs that don't come with MsBuild such as VS Test Agent.

I'll rename the issue name to reflect the findings.

Events.RelatedDescription: Commented on issue "Conditioned warning properties are not respected" (#5712) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Looked more into this - 

The core issue is that in multi-targeting projects, the project system adds a condition on the first tfm of the project. I have filed an issue with them - https://github.com/dotnet/project-system/issues/2804

Events.RelatedDescription: Commented on issue "VS Package Manager: incorrectly handles an invalid source in nuget.config while installing a package from other sources" (#5863) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: With PackageReference installing a package adds a reference to it, then it runs Restore which essentially installs all of the packages again, everything is resolved which is why if a source is missing this can cause restore to pick a different version of the package when looking for a *best* match.

Events.RelatedDescription: Commented on issue "VS Package Manager: incorrectly handles an invalid source in nuget.config while installing a package from other sources" (#5863) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: Actually I don't need an option to ignore a source. When I choose a source I expect that it is only the source to search and install packages from. Why are other sources looked in at all?

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Move error codes with warning numbers to error range" (#5824) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: NU1607 and NU1606 are errors but they are in the warning code range. They should be moved to the error range.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Dependency paths display incorrect version ranges" (#5852) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Dependency paths for downgrade and version conflict messages with PackageReference projects display the incorrect version range for a dependency.

#### Expected:
The version range used in the nuspec

#### Actual:

The range *>= {resolved version}* is used

A new format that includes both the resolved version and the range might make these messages more useful. Alternatively the resolved version could be used for all packages except the conflicts which could show the range.

Related: https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/5463

Opened issue "Announcing the NuGet 'Announcements' repo!" (#1) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
| Spec wiki| Discussion issue| 
| ------------- |:-------------| 
| _None_| https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/4088|

## Announcing the **Announcements** repo!
As a step towards engaging with the community early on, we have created the **NuGet/Announcements** repo to propose new features and to get early feedback before the team starts implementing these features. This repo will be used for team announcements only. To file a bug or start a discussion, please create a new issue on [NuGet client](https://github.com/nuget/home/issues) or [NuGet server](https://github.com/nuget/NuGetGallery/issues). .

All items posted to this repo are locked, but will typically have links to separate discussion threads on one of the NuGet repos, just like this announcement can be discussed more on this issue: https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/4088. 
Please use these discussion threads for questions and comments about a particular announcement.

## Receiving Notifications

Subscribe to this repo to be notified about major changes, upcoming features and other noteworthy announcements in NuGet.

![subscribe](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14800916/29544263-bea081fa-869b-11e7-9c18-b576890ba049.png)

## Using the Issues list

Use the [Feature](https://github.com/nuget/Announcements/labels/Feature) and [Breaking Change](https://github.com/nuget/Announcements/labels/Breaking%20Change) labels to see what's new and changed.

New feature announcements will have one of the following labels:
* [Reviewing](https://github.com/nuget/Announcements/labels/Reviewing) - Feature being proposed and is undergoing review within the team and the community. 
* [Reviewed](https://github.com/nuget/Announcements/labels/Reviewed) - Feature has been reviewed and necessary feedback incorporated. The feature is ready to be implemented.
* [Implemented](https://github.com/nuget/Announcements/labels/Implemented) - Feature has been implemented.
